thread.title: EastEnders spoilers: A family is torn apart by an unexpected event that changes life forever
thread.title_full: EastEnders spoilers: A family is torn apart by an unexpected event that changes life forever

author: Duncan Lindsay
title: EastEnders spoilers: A family is torn apart by an unexpected event that changes life forever
text:
(Picture: BBC) EastEnders are teasing a massive storyline ahead next week that will see one prominent family torn apart by a massive and unexpected event – but as life changes forever, can loved ones pull together and stand by one another or will a clan be divided forever? 
The top secret storyline will come at the end of a week that already sees substantial disaster when the explosive reveal of Michelle Fowler’s affair sees her lose control and trigger huge consequences for many characters.
But the high drama does not stop there when an entirely separate incident rocks the lives of another family – and residents are left reeling by what unfolds.

Our lips have been well and truly sealed over what comes to pass but it’s a big end to a week of unmissable drama in Walford that looks a little like this:
Monday 27th March (Picture: BBC) The Carters throw a 60s theme night. Tina is worried as social services prepare to come and assess Sylvie. Michelle warns Martin that Preston isn’t good for Bex as they announce they are officially a couple.
Kush and Denise struggle to resist each other and Michelle’s secret affair with Preston comes out at the 60s night.
Tuesday 28th March (Picture: BBC) Michelle loses control as her secret explodes with disastrous and potentially life changing consequences. Denise and Kush make their final decision on whether to be a couple while Tina is emotional over Sylvie.
Thursday 30th March The aftermath of earlier events sends shockwaves through the Square. An unexpected incident turns the lives of a Walford family upside down.
Friday 31st March With residents still reeling from recent events, it’s a time for family and friends to pull together – but who will stand by their loved ones and can the past be forgotten?
Cryptic much!?
One to watch: Thursday 30th March at 7:30pm on BBC One.
